message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.ME, cs.CE

The paper proposes a novel algorithm for segmenting regional myocardium-at-risk subtended by obstructed coronary arteries using geometric models derived from cardiac computed tomography images. The algorithm involves computation of the medial axis of the coronary artery and segmentation of the coronary artery and myocardium using the medial axis. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category, as it involves image analysis and segmentation. Additionally, the paper involves mathematical modeling and optimization, which could place it in the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also has applications in clinical medicine, which could place it in the medical imaging (cs.ME) and computational engineering (cs.CE) sub-categories.
